title: FCC Issues First Space Debris Fine
summary: The Federal Communications Commission issued a fine today for violating space debris requirements. The DISH satellite television company must admit liability and pay $150,000 for not properly disposing of its […]

title: FCC fines Dish Network for botched satellite de-orbit
summary: The Federal Communications Commission has fined Dish Network $150,000 for failing to properly remove a satellite from geostationary orbit, the U.S. regulator said Oct. 2 in its first space debris enforcement action.

title: China outlines Chang’e-8 resource utilization mission to the lunar south pole
summary: China has laid out details of its planned Chang'e-8 mission to test in-situ resource utilization on the moon, while also opening the project to international cooperation.

title: SpaceNews Announces Promotion of Kamal Flucker to Global Sales Director

title: FCC enforces first space debris penalty in $150,000 settlement with Dish
summary: The Federal Communications Commission announced a settlement with Dish Network on Monday in the regulator’s first penalty related to space debris.
